description:
Who would have thought a hotel restaurant and bar could be so on point.

From the food to service and especially drinks, this place shouldn't be missed.

Do yourself a favor and check in here for awesome experience. Exceptionally talented cooks and bartenders.
author: Jeff B.

description: The Shareable Charcuterie was spot on, for 2, be sure to ask for additional slices of the bread. The beverages we had were perfect.
author: Dallas S.

description:
As a guest at the Hilton who stayed on the executive level, with access to the executive lounge; we were told that the evening fare was downstairs in the 750 Restaurant & Bar.  This wasn't something we were told at booking or even when I went to get a key to access the executive lounge, and we went down to have our snacks and sips only to be told we needed a voucher.  So, I went to the front desk, and asked for the voucher; this was NOTHING like the executive lounge, it was a choice of one appetizer and 2 drinks.  That wasn't enough to fill the bellies and hold everyone over until dinner, so we ordered food; mac n cheese (tasted like old freezer burn) and french onion soup (flavorless and room temp), the bill was $18.00 for what was likely the worst choices on the menu. 

The appetizers were hard, room temp chicken wings.

Save yourself the time and money, go elsewhere.
author: Lynnette F.

description: Wonderful experience!  Food was obviously very seasonal and the server did a great job being attentive.  My salad was possibly the best I've ever had.  See image.  Highly recommended!
author: Johnny V.

description:
Great food, service and drinks!!  I absolutely loved the 750 Burger with Millionaires Bacon -- and I am picky about my burgers.  They nailed it! 
 Perfect location for a great meal in the financial district.
author: Diane H.

description: Very nice bar/restaurant inside the Hilton San Francisco financial district hotel. I was surprised by the excellent quality of the food. Prices were a little high but for a San Francisco hotel in a nice area not surprising. Staff was fairly attentive although they did have trouble splitting our check so we opted to pay as a group. Overall, if you are staying at the hotel I recommend it. If not, it's probably not worth a stop unless you are in China town but not feeling like Chinese food.
author: Neil J.

description: Had the Millionaire Burger, very, very good.  Burger was perfectly done for my taste and the candied bacon was an unexpected treat.  Highly recommend.
author: Robert G.

description:
I came for a team dinner and tempered expectations upon realizing it was a restaurant inside a hotel. The food was approaching palatable, but bland, definitely not worth it this price point. The quality was comparable to a mid-end chain restaurant like Cheesecake Factory or Olive Garden. With many great restaurants in Jackson Square, it's hard to imagine picking 750 over the other options so close by. I had the salmon, which was not overdone, still tender and soft but not very fresh. The sauce was really rich, because what doesn't taste decent smothered in heavy cream? I thought it'd come in a bed of vegetables given the description but instead it came in a heavy, mushy risotto with only 3 brussel sprouts cut in half and miniscule cubes of squash. 

The host was a little short when asking if we had a reservation (we did) though it wouldn't have mattered since there was no one else there. The server seemed nice enough and made a round on checking in to refill water. Food service was slow considering there weren't that many other people dining. As for the ambiance, the booths were comfortable but had weird pillows. The lighting was a touch bright for bar/restaurant. The main ambiance killer was Fox News was playing on all of the TVs in the background. 

Overall, there's nothing special about this restaurant. I hate to give a one star but most of my experience from the ambiance, service, and food quality falls short of what I'd expect at the price point so I wouldn't come back.
author: Truc N.

description: Mainly for my cocktail.  If I wasn't such a light weight now, I would have had several.  The Desert Flower is tha bomb!  I loved it.  My husband had of course a margarita, and he also ordered a hamburger.  He was impressed  with his hamburger, not sure if it was because we had low expectations or what, but everything was really nice.  This place is very good for a hotel restaurant, and definitely I will need another one of those cocktails.
author: Marisa S.

description:
I am writing this mainly on service. The picture: Chinese New Year Parade. We went out to LiPo for maitai, but couldn't move inside, so went back to our hotel for drinks and some food. It was also packed, and the kitchen was slammed, and we could see managers filling in serving roles. But it was our server, Houari, that was the star of the night. 

My spouse asked him gently if we could sit, and that we didn't really care how long anything took, and he took the best sort of care of us. This was at nine pm, and we found out that he was there since 5am, and after we know he had to be dealing with a lot of ornery people.  You'd never know it. Houari is simply a service superstar. 

The food was pretty delicious. The drinks were well made, but it was Houari that brought us back for breakfast the next morning in a city full of amazing spots to eat.
author: Julie C.

description: Came here for Valentine's dinner and had a good time. The service was good and the food was okay. We had the Prix Fix meal for two. The reason for the three stars being the first course of the meal wasn't good and for the price we paid it was a turn off. But the rest of the courses were good and the food out on the bar area looked good so I'm sure anyone eating out there liked their food. Overall, it was a good Tuesday night.
author: Paul H.

description:
This restaurant is located inside of the Hilton on Kearny Street and deserves zero stars.  I honestly have never had food this bad before at a restaurant.  Being that the dishes on the menu are overpriced, I was expecting so much more, but was sadly disappointed.  

My boyfriend ordered the special for the night which was a lobster macaroni dish and I ordered an asparagus risotto with chicken.  When the lobster macaroni came out, I immediately noticed the burnt cheese/crumbs on top of the macaroni and thought the dish was overdone and was going to be burning hot.  Sadly, when I dug in, the inside was cold while the outside was slightly warm.  My bf sent his dish back telling them it was cold.  Next thing you know, it came back out hot as hell as though someone had just quickly nuked it in the microwave.  The dish was bland, and very greasy with a whole puddle of what looked like oil at the bottom of the bowl.  All I could taste was oil.  They call this their SPECIAL?  Special my ass.  

My dish took a while before it came out way after my bf's and this one was just as gross.  The chicken was steaming hot, but the asparagus risotto and veggies on the side were cold!  I didn't even bother asking them to heat up the risotto after seeing how they nuked the lobster macaroni in the microwave.  My dish lacked flavor as well and also had a pool of what looked like oil at the bottom of the plate.  Plus, the staff just seemed as though they didn't give a flying eff about the food or customer service.  They seemed as though they were just there to make a paycheck.  Needless to say, both dishes were nasty and we only took a couple of bites and left hungry.  At least the staff asked if we wanted to go boxes for the food.  Umm...  no thanks.  I would not give the food to a homeless person.  I don't want to kill anybody with the food.

We left the place starving and decided to head out to another restaurant just within walking distance.  We filled our bellies up with real food and not overpriced microwaved crap.  If you value your life and money, don't eat here!  You're better off going to a fast food joint.  The food will be greasy/oily, but at least it'll taste better and you'll save money.
author: Mon S.

description: Stayed overnight after a conference in the Hilton, and I really wanted eggs benedict for breakfast. I saw the poor reviews, but couldn't find a better option nearby. Unfortunately- the service was pretty inattentive- the servers seemed to be hanging out in the corners, not sure what they were working on, but took a long time to get a menu then to have someone ask for my order. After they delivered my order, they never came back to ask if I needed anything- I had to wonder around the back corners to find them congregated near the kitchen.  My eggs benedict was terrible- the egg was soft boiled instead of poached so no running yolk like what benedicts are define by, and the sauce was cold and very salty.  I give two stars because at least the staff were smiley and nice.
author: Jason M.

description:
We came here for Thanksgiving.  The place wasn't crowded, but it still took several minutes for us to be noticed, and seated.
The menu- the traditional thanksgiving meal wasn't an option.  Very disappointing.  Food was good, although the salmon was served on a wooden plank on the center of the plate...?  We initially thought it was eggplant.  
Service, sub-par.  Nice and friendly staff...  Just slow.
Wouldn't recommend this place for the holidays.
author: Coco L.

description:
WOW‼
There OpenTable connection was down, so I walked over to make a reservation as we are in town on business and our hotel is the Galleria Park Hotel.

The Manager and hostess at the podium were excellent this afternoon so I made a reservation for 6pm.

Went back and decided to sit on the bar side to watch the game. 

Our waitress was great. Ordered appetizers and two Old Fashioned.  Everything great so far.

Ordered a shrimp cocktail and my wife ordered another Old Fashioned. Shrimp cocktail was great, the second Old Fashioned was pink and the waitress knew it was not right and as she set it down she said the bartender is away and there is a fill in. My Wife said immediately no please take that back. Well I sat and watched the exchange between our waitress and the fill in behind the bar. Attitude is all he had for that terrible drink. Well as the waitress dropped off a glass of water my Wife said did I offend him? Yes I think so she says. 

Well, Mr Manager behind the bar you lost two customers, we paid and went to the Burritt Room.  

A Manager who can't make a good drink and then an attitude. 

We won't be back
author: Jim G.

description: Can I give it less than 1 star? This place was terrible. The manager has no service skills and treated us horribly. We asked for a house wine and received a wine that was double the price, then he muttered something like we are out of that house wine but offered no solution and just took the wine and the check back and never talked to us again! He worst bar/restaurant/Hilton experience ever!
author: Mario M.

description:
I'm the girl who loves the quality hotel bar and Hilton Chinatown is classy. I've had mixed experiences but we all love that about the hotel bar. The people watching aspect of the hotel bar.

The first time, it was meeting my girls as the first stop of the night. Great place to gather, good selection of cocktails or beer. 

The second time and most recent was filled with fans and cougars, being that the Niners were town and the prowl was on. Watching the flirt on between the two was total entertainment. If you have not witnessed this, it's GOLD.

"Omg, the fun part I'd think is the drunk chicks at the bar and for once that is not me", real time quote and pretty damn awesome.
.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
We decided to make a reservation here (and cancelled at Bluestem Brasserie) after calling about their menu--what a mistake! 

Service was atrocious, management was unconcerned, and the food was subpar. We went to the 750 Restaurant & Bar for Thanksgiving dinner, however, we would've had a better meal at Denny's. 

Below is the 4-course dinner "special":
Course 1: it (soup) was pretty good
Course 2: was a soggy salad that was replaced with another old set of greens, and brought out along side the 3rd course (entree)
Course 3: included a cold steak and a salty gravy sauce, which we had to have replaced while everybody else finished their entree
Course 4: a selection of 6 desserts disguised as a selection of 25 different options that were from Safeway (or the equivalent), all for $75/person + $20 for wine pairing (WTF?)!

Furthermore, we were never offered any bread upon being seated unlike other tables, and the "for the table" plates (side dishes served family style) were not brought out until we were 1/2 way done with our entrees.

Take home message: should never be an option and management should be reconsidered.
author: Aleks G.

description: I really don't like giving one star to anyone.  I feel like anyone who runs a business wants to do the right thing and provide the highest quality product possible. This place really missed the mark.  What makes matters worse is that it is associated with a Hilton hotel... A hotel that I spend at least 26 weeks a year patronizing.  My first order of the lobster macaroni not only came out stone cold, but also came out 10 minutes before my girlfriend's very mediocre asparagus risotto.  After sending the dish back... It returned piping hot but equally disgusting.  I am absolutely positive that my dish was microwaved.  The lobster was chewy and the macaroni had no flavor.  Please see my photo of the "lobster macaroni" and revel its painfully microwaved disgustingness.
author: Frank M.

description: I used the yelp coupon. It was $35 for $50 worth of food. The food portions were generous. However, I got very sick shortly after breakfast. the only think I had different from my family was chicken apple sausage. So, I would say to steer clear of the encased meats. My eggs were cooked perfect and the fruit salad was a nice mix of pineapple and melon.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Weekend breakfast buffet only --
Our friends were staying in town at the Hilton at 750 Kearny in the Financial District.  They have small kids so we decided meeting them here for breakfast would be best and convenient for all.  We made a reservation for 9:30 AM, and they nicely had a table for us (4 adults, 1 child and 1 baby).  Service was very courteous and mindful that we had small children in our party.  The buffet was solid tasting with the breakfast standards, and they also had dim sum.  :)  That put a smile on our faces!  We had a lovely time catching up with our friends and we weren't rushed out the door as they were setting up for the jazz brunch.

Nice to know about this breakfast buffet (plus, it is reasonably priced) - I wouldn't have known about it if our friends weren't staying here!
author: Maile N.

description:
Kind of expensive for the buffet it is. My mom got a Groupon for buy one person, get one person in for free.  It came with free Jazz on Sunday & bottomless Champagne.  Another factor to weigh in is that the buffet isn't in Las Vegas, so you can't hold it up to Vegas standards.

Highlights:
-Prime Rib. This was my favorite, I should have eaten more of it. It was cooked very well, seasoned well, and was very tender. 
-Make-your-own-omlettes - tell the guy what you want inside, he makes it for you! Everyone gave a standing ovation. 
-Crab cakes were hand-made, which was yummy. These were a popular item of the buffet, everyone kept waiting for them to come out!
-Chicken Picatta was good. I liked the flavor, and this item was one of the better ones.

Things to hold off on:
-Chinese food. The batch I ate seemed to be sitting there for a while. I did try the fried rice later on, and it was okay. Nothing to write home about though.

Service didn't seem quite there, they didn't seem to know when to take plates away or when to give us the bill. I'm hopeful though since this place is on the newer side. The jazz was worth it though, I enjoyed every minute of it. Bottomless champagne was delicious, but I think it needed to be there for the buffet to be worth it.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch buffet: incredibly delicious and unlimited oysters, crab legs and shrimp cocktail?!? Am I in seafood heaven? 

There was a jazz band playing, so the ambiance was very classy. It was about 10am and I didn't make reservations, but our table of 6 got seated in about 10 minutes after asking.  We got the bottomless mimosa deal which was about $40/person. If not, I think it's probably $30/person?

The presentation and food was so clean and fresh. There was a wonderful omelette station (love customized food!), also dim sum (which works to incorporate the Chinatown feel) and fresh fruit. 

This is definitely a place to go to really go enjoy a meal. If I didn't have plans afterwards, I would have stayed here all day and done the Vegas buffet walk around to digest my food before I went back for more. I would recommend this spot to anyone!!

It is a little pricey, but it's worth every penny!
author: Clara T.

description: It's a hotel bar/restaurant.  If you're staying at the hotel and want to grab a beer or a decent meal go for it.  If you're not staying at the hotel...move along.
author: Mike D.

description:
3.5 stars.  Only for lunches.

The food is actually quite good for being so close to north beach's terrible food! Generous portions and never bland in flavor. 

Come to this place if you want typical comfort food and you want food quick- it's never very full, since the financial district people don't come into this hotel for their meals.  Just go into the hilton, walk all the way towards the back, have a seat, flag a person down, and get your order in.  I've enjoyed the ahi tuna (get sauce on side), pork chop, french dip sandwich and their crab salad.  You'll be full after an entree and split of a dessert.  The only downsides are that service can be a little scattered, but they are friendly and at around $25 -30 for a lunch entree, it's not cheap but it's what is expected out of a hilton.
author: Hannah W.

description:
I ate here three mornings in a row while I was staying at the hotel. Hostess was mute, very little greeting and no warmth. On the second day she sat me at a dirty table and moved the second place setting (from the last guest) over to my place......GROSS!!!!!! This is a beautiful hotel and you are sitting me at a dirty table. Service was extremal slow and the servers never returned once I got my food. Last day I sat down and a server brought over juice and coffee, I did not ask for either. I drank the coffee and not the juice but then I was charged for both. 
Meals
1. Eggs Benedict - Was ok, could get the same at the local diner
2. Egg, Sausage, Croissant - WAY to greasy
3. Blueberry Pancakes - Very good! This was the only good thing about the place and is why they are getting any stars.
author: Geri Z.

description:
This is going to be one hell of a tough review for me to write - mostly because I am a Hilton Platinum Club member and I love the Hilton experience overall. This restaurant is located inside the Chinatown Financial District Hilton. 

I spent 2 1/2 hours and $150 bucks for the SPECIAL EASTER BRUNCH. 

5 STARS for the live band, but they needed to take less breaks, or play some recorded music when they were off, cause when there was no music it sounded dead.

5 STARS for the food, as it was probably the best buffet and live prepared food I have ever had.

4 STARS for the Easter Bunny, Magician and Easter Egg guy, they sure made the experience fun (at least in the beginning).

1 STAR and a grade of F- for the absolutely atrocious service that I have ever seen. 

I will give the two hostess ladies a THUMBS UP for effort and for putting up with 200 pissed off customers trying to get in, and DEFINITELY two thumbs up for the tall white bald manager guy as he was the only one that was truely working that day. You sir, were the only staff in the front of the house that was worth a penny. 

Apparently, they only had two bussers, which turned into one and two bussers called in sick. But seriously, you have a BallRoom with four scheduled and a five hour brunch? What, did you just get out of Hospitality Management at SF City College?

0 Stars for the servers, both the girls and both the guys. Shame on all of you for not being proper servers, owning and taking responsibility for your tables and for letting customers walk away cause you were too busy walking around aimlessly waiting for bussers to do work for you - and they never came - and your customers left.

It was entertaining at some level to watch them walk around and do nothing for the 2 1/2 hours i was inside. The servers were apparently too good to actually do anything which they relied ont he non-existent bussers to do. The entire server staff of four that I saw were worthless across the Board. 

It was even more ridiculous when I guess someone called in MANAGERS fromvarious floors and departments for reinforcements. The one lady was okay, but generally they seemed annoyed and blind to the stack and stacks of dishes that were all over the place and tables a mess. OR they were too "high up" on the ladder to actually do anything like clear a table with a large tray, bring out some linens and silverware and pour water!

People were waiting and waiting and waiting. GOOD LORD, there was even a group of three smoking hott blondes waiting to get in....and families with children...you could not set up a table for them, really? 

As for me, due to Open Table, I got a guaranteed reservation and I dropped my Paltinium Hilton card when I walked in so I waited like no more than 5 minutes from the time I walked up and got my champagne and was immediately seated - 

As I walked by all those poor people that had been waiting forever (lots of them with hungry children for Easter), I got the "WHO THE HELL IS THAT GUY LOOK" and I so wanted to take them all in with me. Selfishly, I had a great time. But the ambiance created by the stacking dirty dishes around me, confused staff and pissed off customers in every direction, was too much.  

Whoever is in charge, the GM or the actual owner of the "750" needs to watch the video taped from the lobby and from the ballroom for Sunday Easter Brunch. I personnaly counted 93 people that left at one point of another, which would have been like $5,580 in sales (at $60 brunch price per person).

DAMN HILTON CHINATOWN, you must really not care about the customers in order to flush 6 grande down the toilet on a Sunday. it is really hard to perform this bad, but this NEVER would have happened at a Mariott or other brand hotel. 
You owe apologies to the families and children that waited for a brand promise that never came. 

But at some level, there is some justice in the world. 
Your moron servers set a table for 14 and opened and poured a case of champagne that went totally flat on a table. I guess they didnt teach anyone that works at Hilton that champagne is not like water and you dont let it sit on the table to get cold and flat for a "big" reservation that had already shown up and left....
author: Michael C.

description:
Came here for a Sunday jazz brunch buffet with a groupon in hand.   We got there at 11:45am and there's a line to get seated but it was done fast enough.  I would say make sure you have a reservation though.  2 hour free valet parking(fast too!)... nice!  

I agreed with another yelper about the volume of the jazz band, once we got seated 3 tables away from the jazz band for 2 minutes, we asked if they can move us.  The band played really nice but the volume is probably only good for a show but not for a relaxing brunch.  It's impossible to have any conversation at all but that's just us.  Lucky enough, they moved us to a quiet(er) secluded room (only after a couple minutes)  which we can still hear the music fine and had a good time.  A++ service!

The food is pretty nice, crab legs(cracked in halves ready to eat), crab claws, shrimp, raw oyster the usual... prime rib was rare and fat.. nice... not many sashimi/sushi choices but very fresh...smoke salmon, baked fish, desserts... omelet station (i didn't try), some breakfast food... the dim sum is really weird though... especially the siu mai does not look like a siu mai at all... being a few steps from china town.. that's kind of funny....  overall the food is quite good.

Service is good, champagne glasses were filled every 10 minutes or so..  we were asked numerous times if everything is ok or if they can bring us anything.  The manager came around twice to talk and filled up our water glasses!  Love that!!    No one rushed us and it's just a great experience.

While I may not go often if I need to pay the full price, but definitely will buy another Groupon if they offer it again.. haha!
author: Jo L.

description: Waiting for some friends driving up from L.A. to check-in...., my stomach was growling for a burger.  So me and another friend went to the bar area and ordered the 750 burger and it was surprisingly delish!  They also had 2 huge tvs showing the warriors game.  The only thing I regret was sharing the burger.  Will definetly come back and try other items on the menu.
author: Jocylyn P.

description:
Sunday Jazz Brunch, brought to us by Groupon.

This Groupon was a gift.  We were excited to go and picked superbowl Sunday as a good bet for light crowd (check).  Read the yelp reviews before going... good idea.

The Jazz -  a solid 5.  Great swingin' quartet doing standards.  Really made it a fun time.  Always fun to see kids in families dancin' between tables.

The Bottomless Champagne - 4. This isn't a special cuvee but whatever they are pouring is very drinkable with no nasty effects. That deserves a brunch thumbs-up.

The Room - 3.  It's big and comfortable but could use some updating.  Decorations for Chinese New Year really helped.  Maybe they should keep them!

The Food - 3, YMMVdepending.  When we got up to recon the different food stations (don't you hate that word, food station?  I guess it's true, the guests are basically cows being fattened, but I don't relish the reminder)  I saw the Most Interesting Man in the World, and he was looking the food over with a small entourage... I heard him say "choose wisely my friends," and I made a point of noting his selections, which included crab cakes with grilled asparagus and a side tarragon cream sauce, crab claws, smoked salmon and prime rib.  The seafood items are all "A" grade and the prime rib is a "B"... taken together, a delightful protein bomb that you will survive just fine.   

The traditional breakfast items didn't look so great - steam tables were invented by a food devil.  Who would pay $38 for that stuff anyway... why not just clear the space?  The Asian items (Steam Table II, the Sequel) looked scary.  I did try the pork dumplings; it would have been better if I'd taken one instead of two.  

The desserts looked fancy but I was, guu-uuhhh-uuppp, a little full so I tasted the pecan pie, a personal weakness - pecan-y but too sweet, and a lemon curd tart that just needed more acid zing.  I think hotel kitchens are afraid of full flavor and irritating the land of the bland white-food-eaters.  A pity.

I had a really good time.  The Jazz was really great.  The best food items were really good.  The Groupon made it a great deal, and let's not forget the validated parking (nice!).  Not sure I'd pay full price to go back but I'm happy to recommend this as a great time traditional+ brunch.
author: Bob K.

description: Amazing Easter brunch. Delicious, interesting, beautiful food and superb service. Houari is the best server ever.
author: Courtney B.

description:
A friend with a Groupon deal invited me to brunch here and I have to admit, didn't know what to expect, especially after reading the mixed Yelp reviews and it's a hotel brunch.  Short version, no need to fear! What an incredibly fun Sunday jazz brunch.  Finding street parking right away on a Sunday, in Chinatown, should have been a sign.

We were seated immediately and service was impeccable throughout our 3 hour brunch! Water, coffee, champagne were refilled regularly.  The breakfast entrees, fresh sushi, seafood, cooked-to-order omelette, and prime-rib stations were surprisingly up to par. Definitely check out the oysters and poached shrimp.  The desserts, not so. I had no stomach real estate left for the hot lunch entrees. So, this review doesn't cover them.

Staff didn't rush us, though we were one of the few remaining tables left at the end of brunch service.  Overall, I'd return.   

Note: 2 hour free valet service with brunch!
author: M G.

description:
Had dinner here last night with 2 other people........fine service from a.houari but food was pretty average.
Service can make up for a lot and our service was excellent...just wish I could say as much for the food.

Nice deserts.
author: Jon W.

description:
This review is for the power lunch buffet; and we used our Groupon for lunch..  Hubby and I went on a Monday.  We were greeted by Mimi, and another gentleman.  Mimi was very nice- like she could be your buddy (quoting my husband's words).  The selection for the day was good.  I particularly like the salad with salmon, and the choices of dressing.  There were 3 main entrees:  seafood (tilapia with salmon, topped with shrimp; baked), chicken (teriyaki, I think) and beef (I didn't try bec I don't usually eat beef - though, hubby said it was salty and chewy).  There were several other hot dishes, such as Fried Rice, Noodles, Mixed Veggies, and Pasta.
There was also a sandwich bar- deli meats, veggies, and choice of sliced bread.  Two soups, and a small selection of desserts.  Not a bad experience for a weekday lunch.  We were in and out within the hour.  I will definitely suggest this to our managers- sometimes he just doesn't know where to take out of town managers.  This place is perfect since there are so much options.
author: Margaret W.

description:
This is a review for the Sunday Jazz Brunch.

A couple of friends enticed us to check out the Jazz Sunday brunch buffet. My friends had a groupon deal but my BF and I didn't. Apparently the hotel will validate parking for 2 hours if you dine. That was enough to get us to go. The normal price is pretty good already. $39 for an adult including champagne. That is a steal, especially if you are with a large party that drinks! We set up a reservation easily and were seated promptly (table for 6). The buffet spread was quite impressive: pastry, granola and jook station, cereal, fruit, scrambled eggs/bacon/sausage/waffles, omelet station, cold bar (shrimp/steamed mussels), dessert spread and the best station....PRIME RIB station. Of course I went for the prime rib first before any other station. It was succulent, juicy, moist, flavorful and best part. I got to put on my own amount of au jus. Every station is pretty good. Unlimited champagne and OJ made it a hit for us. 

$40/per person, live jazz, 2 hours validation in garage, PRIME RIB, fast efficient service. I will be coming back for sure.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Ok, first off, I tend to not the one that gives bad reviews or any reviews for that matter. I will however, when I am extremely happy or extremely pissed I feel that that place warrants a review. Anyways onto this one star review. 

Valentines Day + guy with a girlfriend = a (must have a) nice dinner.

Chose this place mainly because they had a Valentines Day special going on. Reservations at 8pm, seated promptly. A+ so far. 

Waiter greeted us (never gave his name, had to see it on his name tag) asked us how is our nice, small chit chat, gave him our order (valentines day special filet mignon and lobster tail): one rare, one medium rare) simple right? 

Maybe 10 mins goes by, another couple gets seated next to us, we exchange "hi's" and thats it. Their waiter brings them bread. Us? nothing so far.. interesting. 

Flag down our waiter, ask him for some bread, maybe 5 mins later he brings us our "valentines day special champagne".. 5 mins after that the bread. whatever.

Enjoying the champagne, and I see that the couple who sat after us gets their valentines day meals. intertesting.. the gf and I look at each other, and we both look for the waiter. 

(maybe) 15 mins go by, hoping the next time we see our waiter pop out its with our food. nope. nothing. having alcohol + being mad = disaster. 

so pissed off and in a bad mood and its valentines day, totally sucks.. so finally we decide to flag the waiter, mention to him that the people next to us got their food (and finished it) and we were wondering about ours. so he leaves and says he will check on it.

10 seconds later out food arrives, how convenient. well whatever, try to enjoy it right? wrong.. cut into the filet mignon..  well done.. great..  too much for one night so, flag the waiter, told him about the mignon, how unhappy we were and to box the "valentines day special cake" and the check. He says sorry and that he will take care of it or whatever. comes back and gave us a discount. Very buzzed at this point and VERY pissed, I decided to leave the exact amount. Gf got mad so i left $3 on top. Never done that ever until today. More sucks that it happened on Valentines day.
author: erwin b.

description: This is probably the worst restruaunt experience for the money paid, ever! I've had meals that were just as sub par, but they were at Denny's and any other s-hole that charges you no more than $10-$15 a head. This place charged $75 a head for Christmas dinner and was on par with a Sizzler. HORRIBLE - Stay far far away.
author: Ryan L.

description:
We decided to eat at Seven Fifty purely because we were lazy.  It was in the hotel we were staying at, and we had a cranky three year old with us.  Venturing out to find something else was just not in the cards.

I wish we would have gone somewhere else.  My husband ordered steak, I ordered the lobster ravioli.  I may be so scarred by the meal I was delivered that not only will I never eat here again, but I may never order lobster ravioli again either.

The main failures in my meal:  Cold.  I'm not talking warm, or even a little warm-cold.  Cold, cold.  Disgustingly cold.  My ravioli was HARD, like it had not been cooked at all.  The lobster inside was cold and flavorless.  The sauce on the plate with the mushrooms tasted like packaged gravy.  Funky flavor, and not enjoyable at all.  I took one bite and pushed the plate away.  My husband asked them to take the food back and the waiter said he would have them make a new plate [of the same thing].  There is no way that warm or hot this meal would be any better.  It was just nasty.  I was so put off that I didn't want anything else to eat after it.

The waiter [though, nice] came back a couple minutes later and said, "The chef, he says that the ravioli is meant to be that way... it is supposed to be tender... and um.. the lobster is cooked".  I said "That wasn't the problem.  The ravioli was very HARD, not tender, and the whole plate of food was cold.  That was the problem".  He said sorry and that he would replace it with anything else for me.  I told him again, I couldn't eat anything.  It really just put me off of the whole meal.  And geez... if the chef says that the way I received my meal is the intended way to eat it, they need to hire a new chef.  That meal was unacceptable.  Inedible, really.

My husband ordered dessert after he finished his meal [which he was okay with] because it was our daughter's birthday, and by that point I decided to see if the dessert could redeem them.  Nope.  FROZEN, flavorless "pudding" aka creme brulee with an extremely thin layer of sugar on top.  Fail, Seven Fifty.  Overall, complete fail.
author: Madeleine D.

description:
Went in for Sunday Jazz brunch

Like any hotel breakfast buffet (minus the ones in Vegas), various dishes were good, but most were not. Breakfast cost was $39 pp, that came with live jazz band, bottomless champagne and breakfast. I'm a bit on the fence whether the cost was really worth it. The food was mediocre, if not sub-par, the standard breakfast items were okay, nothing outstanding, the roast beef and other entree-lunch dishes were hit or miss. Notable the roast beef and chicken picatta were notably good. 

My other major complaint is that service is rather slow... The waiters took a good while to clear our plates when we went up for seconds. I guess I'm used to Vegas-style buffets where servers are courteous and immediately clear your table at your convenience. During our breakfast, we often found our table with stacks of plates due to lack of servers working. 

Bottomless champagne was good considering it was included in our price. Jazz band was jamming and provided good entertainment. Otherwise 750 Restaurant bar is nothing to write home about and easily a place to pass on if you're in the area
author: Justin L.

description:
As ghetto as it sounds I LOVE eating at hotel restaurants.  I especially love a good hotel breakfast buffet.  I think it's because it feels like I'm on vacation.  And that is what you do in a hotel on vacation!  We decided to go to the Hilton one sunday morning for some jazz and breakfast buffet.  It's really your typical hotel & breakfast buffet, exactly what you'd expect.  I did like the fresh seafood.  I think the man next to me as well did because he was 100% stealing the oysters and cocktail shrimp into a black plastic baggie on his lap.  Should I be horrified or give this man props?  I think I'll stick with disguist as I can imagine what that seafood smelled like after being removed from ice.  

All in all I had a good experience here.  Service was good, lots of champagne filled quickly and tons of delicious brunch food.  Don't expect anything amazing, it is a hotel breakfast buffet.  I didn't really like the jazz, I'm old and it was too loud.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Went for the weekend buffet. Wait staff was wonderful; very courteous and friendly. The manager came around and talked with our group for a good 5 minutes.
Loved the food selection. favorites: crab (pre-cracked and ready to eat), bbq'd pulled pork (or maybe is was just shredded bbq prok), salmon, & the whole desert table. 2 hours valet parking made the experience even better.
author: Julie Z.

description: We are guests at the Hilton and ordered room service after a busy day of sight seeing. We had a cup of soup, wedge salad and turkey club. It was so good and generously portioned we could of ordered less. Service was great and tip/ service charge included .  Thank you.
author: Gina K.

description: If you like food that's been in the fridge and just reheated  or an over cooked filet or poor service, no salt or pepper on any tables,...then you're in luck.  750 is the place to go for all these things and more!
author: J L.

description: Mid-week lunch buffet was good at the groupon price of $8, but I'd only give it 3 stars still on the assumption of regular price of $16.  Positives: the small dessert items were high class artisan quality.  Get the thing that looks like it's wrapped in a star covered paper, but the paper is chocolate and there is a mousse-cake like substance inside.  Excellent.  The main steak dish that was advertised on the menu online was not being offered and instead they had some Chinese beef and chicken items.  Actually not too bad and the chicken was my preferred.  Salads weren't that exciting.  No one came to offer water to us until we asked.  Breads were sub-par.  Setting is nice and napkins were good quality.  I'd return maybe at the $8 price again when starving and if they have those good dessert items still.
author: Marc S.

description:
Man this place is terrible. 

I ate a catered meal here at a conference. The food was just bad. As in, I left lunch hungry. It was an Italian buffet with the saddest pasta I've ever had. The pasta Bolognese tasted like unseasoned tomato sauce with meat in it. Their other pasta dish was completely overcooked and had frozen vegetables in it. Best part was the garlic bread. I know it's a hotel restaurant, but they should seriously get their act together! I'd never order room service from this place.
author: Emily K.

description:
I have stayed and eaten breakfast at the Hilton several times.  Great location.

The breakfast buffet is nice, but a bit pricey compared to other hotels, but this is the heart of SF.  Towards the end the buffet gets a little stale, so go earlier rather than later.  Nice to have Dim Sum for breakfast.

The hostess Glerythel is extremely friendly, efficient, and always greets you with a smile and obviously works very hard organizing the seating when the place is really busy and the line gets backed up.  The busboys run around like mad, and the servers seem to barely have time for you when the place is full.

Nice atmosphere...nicer than most hotel dining rooms.
author: Joe S.

description:
Came here thanks to a Groupon Coupon, and we are now fans. Generally 39 per person for brunch.
Seafood fresh and tasty
Crab cakes alone are my fav
Mimosa's and jazz band makes it a five star winner
Service was fluid and the staff works very well together.  A champagne glass spilled and broke and they were so gracious about cleaning it up RIGHT AWAY, getting a new filled glass, and making sure we were good.
You can forget this is really a hotel Restaurant until you look at the decor and it is boom,  hotelish.  It would be nice if they update is a bit.  What surprised me even though I read the reviews was considering we are in Chinatown, how can the dim sum be off and it was. I figured the pot sticker was safe and nope, the first bite of the edge was crunch.  But I was warned, so that was my fault.
author: Carol H.

description:
Weekday buffet lunch for 4.

We all walked from our homes or took BART so we did not have 1st hand experience with parking.  However, a Chinatown public parking garage is just across the street.

We were seated promptly, the decor was quiet, modern, & clean.  The staff was friendly & attentive throughout.

While there was a good variety of food the selection was not lavish.  My favorite entre was the sauted salmon.  While I liked the dessert offerings, my favorite was chocolate mousse in a solid dark chocolate mini-cup, they were limited.  Less than what is offered at many buffets.  

While not on par with the best buffets, it is moderately priced, & it does seem to stress quality over quantity.
author: Saul M.

description:
After brunching here today i wanted to write a review on their " power lunch Buffet "

I would have to say , i feel the same way that Irene L  felt on this place. I might of even had the lunch at the same time as her . the Food was ehhh . The Service is good  . The dessert is better then the food selection. Thank God for the Groupon deal.
author: Michael T.

description:
All the meats and hot foods were delish!  Chicken dish, crab cakes, bacon, all yum!!

What wasn't yum, waffles were cold and hard, chinese dim sum was lacking (but who cares chinatown is a stones throw away).  

Service was great, champagne flowed, price was reasonable.  I would return!
author: Kelli M.

description:
I'll keep this short...

This is just for the bar at the Grille at Seven Fifty at the Hilton Hotel, SF.

I came down for a drink when I was staying at the Hilton. I ordered their Truffled Parmesan Fries, their Mini sausages and a beer. 

Their fries has no taste of truffle oil or Parmesan, they were plain fries that were probably frozen and fried and served. The piggies were served in a bowl. That's it. Nothin else. The sausages were all by themselves, the presentation looked worse than what I would prepare at home. They tasted good, probably because they were preserved with 20 million things.

What pissed me off the most was when I got my fries, I grabbed a few napkins (3-6 of them), the bartender saw me and took them back saying 'We're trying to go green here and save the Earth.' I wanted to throw my bowl of fries and weiners at her and give her the finger, but instead I ate my fries like a grumpy old man and left a measly tip.

Service sucks here and their food sucks. I definitely will not come here again or ever give this place any business if I'm staying at the Hilton. It's a shame because the hotel itself wasn't that bad. 

The bar and the Bartender there can suck it.

Nuff' said.
author: Sunny D.

description:
The place stinks. I was staying at the hotel and came here both for breakfast and for dinner and the last negative review is completely what went though as well. 

The service is REALLY bad and the food is just about kinda OK. But this seems to extend to this Hilton in its entirety as well. I am a diamond honors member but I ended negotiating for breakfast (I had a colleague join me), negotiating for dinner (we wanted just a couple of drinks and appetizers) and negotiating for an extension of my room for a night.

PATHETIC AND A DISGRACE TO A HILTON!!!!
author: Mukund B.

description: Had lunch here while attending a conference.  Pizza and service were terrible.  Also, made my reservation via Open Table and still waiting for the points to be awarded to my account.
author: Gina M.

description:
On a recent trip to San Francisco my friend and I made a reservation at 750 Restaurant & Bar after looking over the menu on Savored. Honestly it should be 750 Bar since the restaurant area was not open and we were basically in a hotel lobby bar with flat-screen TV's and drunk tourists.

Even though the ambiance was not what we had expected the food and the service made up for it. We started with a Cheese and Charcuterie Platter then shared the Peking Duck Potstickers and Caesar Salad, which was a great start. I then ordered the Asian Pear and Chicken Pizza and my friend had the Soy Lacquered Short Ribs and we both had plenty of leftovers to take home with us. I also ordered the Red Velvet Cupcakes to go. Very tasty.

I guess it is true what they say about judging a book by it's cover. Even though it would have been nice to be away from the TV's and all the football fans we had a good night.
author: Scott F.

description: I am a huge fan of hotel breakfast buffets. This one happens to be quite small in comparison to similar hotels.  The fruit was fresh and the selection of breads and baked goods was nice, however there were not very many varieties of hot items. I would recommend taking a look at the buffet before ordering it to see if it will meet your needs.
author: Amy D.

description:
Inside of SF Financial District Hilton...
Not bad...
Good customer service
Good place to have a drink with company
author: Flora C.

description:
Not a morsel of their food has crossed my lips yet, and I already know this is going to be a zero star experience. While the two hostesses wander ineffectually around the  empty lobby looking for the Marino party that has very obviously left (might I suggest under the table ladies?) my boyfriend and I continue to stare unblinkingly at the table for 2 that has sat empty and unset in the 45 minutes we have waited to be seated. We're staring at it in the hopes that we can mentally will it to set itself, since there are apparently no staff working at the restaurant today. Just overheard a newcomer asking if her group can be seated early. I struggle to control my mirth, unsuccessfully. EARLY? You poor naive fool.

 I'm now considering the benefits of sticking around, so I can pay $60 to scarf down buffet items in the 30 minutes I have before my next engagement. I literally cannot think of a reason to stay. My stomach has digested itself so I'm not even hungry anymore. OMG Hostess Lady the Marino party is NOT here! I know this because nobody in this rapidly emptying lobby has answered to that name the last 5 times you called it! 

I'm now considering adopting the name Marino. I fully believe she will accept this since has not noticed me, or anyone else for that matter, for the past 45 minutes. All she thinks about is her precious Marinos.

Oh God, here comes the second hostess. I literally cannot bear to hear the word Marino again. Never again in life.

Apparently neither can my boyfriend. We're leaving.
author: Olivia S.

description: We had a groupon for brunch which they just started this year.  We attempted to make a reservation but got the impression that you could not make one for brunch.  So we showed up the day of and were turned away.  They said they were booked solid although more than half their tables were empty.  I explained the confusion and she simply advised us to make a reservation for next time, and was like "have a great day".  She never offered to assist us to make a reservation.  Not pleasant.  Although we have a reservation for next time now, and I will be writing an addition to this review.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Like many, we got the Groupon.  Given it was the last Sunday before it expires, there were quite a few like us looking to get in and use our Groupon.  Right when I was about to give up, we were lead to our table - at the same time, I heard they were extending the Groupon for one additional week.  

The best part of the brunch is the jazz band.  We were just a couple tables away and didn't think it was too loud.  The food is truly subpar, especially the shrimp cocktail, cracked crab claws...the cooked food were so unattractive, we didn't even bother trying.  The small section with the sliced cheese, meat and salmon looked dry and old.  The fish for the sushi were not fresh - if you want any, stick with the unagi.  The corned beef hash was edible.  The pot sticker ok, the siu mai is a joke and the small bbq pork bun was the surprise of the day.  The bun was thin and moist and the bbq pork filling was plenty and flavorful.  The congee and oatmeal are plain with no garnishes or sides to add to it.  The dessert and pastries section looked good but nothing tasted good - the cheesecake was the worst I've had.  If you don't want to eat frozen food, recommend you stick with the prime rib and the omelet station.  

Besides the food, they went out of clean dishes often.  Some dishes were still wet and some with food on it - quite disgusting.  

Service was not there.  We had dirty dishes on our tables a few times and had to wave someone down to pick them up.  Our champagne glasses were only filled up once.
author: Gloria H.

description:
My wife & I went to Seven Fifty because it was a perfect location to have dinner before seeing "Peter Pan". Our evening got off to a shaky start, as we were not given menus for quite some time after being seated. We tried the short ribs (mediocre) and the fish (pretty good). 

The main reason for the low rating is what happened after the meal. As a member of the Passport dining club (which provides 2-for-1 deals at participating restaurants), I presented my membership card, and one of the meals was removed from the bill. About a week later, I was re-billed for this meal, and it took several phone calls with their accounting department before they agreed to credit me back again.

All things considered, the next time we return to San Francisco, we'll try somewhere else.
author: Mark R.

description:
Pos: I went there for Saturday Breakfast buffet, there isn't many option, but very delicious.  I love the food and so does my kid.  Bacon and egg white, smoke salmon, fruits.  Foods are good for kids and adult.  

Cons:  Morning breakfest buffet is closing at 10 am a little bit too earlier. I think 11 would be great!  Buffet is quiet expensive. 22 / person and was not too much choice.  I can go more often if for  $12. to the management, $12/ person X 3 in family, it was $40 out of the door. we can come often!
author: YI W.

description:
If you like a tough piece of meat served at room temperature, I highly recommend their prime rib special. I sent the first one back as it was sub-room temperature. The replacement was a hair warmer, but the vegetables were overcooked, and the baked potato was so cold it wouldn't melt the butter. The only positive was the bartender.

My own fault - there's so many better choices in SF.
author: Jeff W.

description: Great service, mediocre food.  Asparagus was overcooked, steaks were too fatty, salads were OK.  Service and wine suggestions were first-rate.
author: Joseph E.

description: Came here for the Mother's Day champagne brunch they had. Food was great and the service was better. They ran out of roses and they went out their way to go find one for my mother. I appreciated that! Will be back next year.
author: Trent O.

description: Yuck. Thank god this was a groupon deal. My lunch was pretty much ruined- b/c I came starving and the best food I ate- fresh fruit. Super disappointed in the food they served. Prime rib steak? Ha. Kid you not, must have been in that nasty beef soup they made. Hot food = nothing good. Cold food= did not seem fresh. Overall, frozen food reheated? I don't know, and cannot imagine. 1 star for great hostess and atmosphere. No i shall not and will not return. Must be a joke to charge 17 a person for lunch on a weekday.
author: Monika T.

description:
Where do I go for a breakfast business meeting in or near Chinatown?  At this point, the room usually falls silent.  Then, the financial district hotel names start popping, "Hyatt?  Omni?  Mandarin?"  This restaurant is located at the former Holiday Inn Financial District, which sits on the border between Chinatown and the Financial District on Kearny Street (their neighbors are predominantly Chinese businesses).  On one weekday morning, I chose this place because a) the atmosphere is nicer than those Chinatown bakeries (quieter and relaxed) and b) the service is very good (continuous checking of coffee cups and juice glass).  I opted for the full breakfast buffet ($21.00) versus the continental breakfast buffet ($16.00).  Both options come with coffee, tea, and/or milk.  This is much nicer than the previous 2nd floor setup where the food stations remind you of a Fresh Choice experience.  Now, they arrange two long tables, one behind the hostess' station with the hot foods and one in the rear area of the adjoining bar with the continental offerings (pastries, cereals, etc.).
Since I was here for the meeting, not so much for the culinary experience, I took portions of scrambled eggs, bacon (thick slices, cooked well done, the way I like it), sausages, smoked salmon, diced breakfast potatoes, and some fruit.  I asked the waiter for a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice which was very refreshing.  I chose this option as it is a better buy than the ala carte items that range from $12.00 to $15.00 per entree.
They gave me the tiny ketchup and Tabasco sauce bottles for the potatoes; I think I may need senior assistance soon as I couldn't open the Tabasco one.  
As we finished our breakfast, I noticed the staff preparing a few tables for parties of fifteen or more, likely for office business lunches.  Would I come back?  Yes, if it for a similar type meeting, but, for an everyday meal, I'd likely eat a block or two uphill from here.  They serve lunch and dinner too, but, given the numerous other options, I would probably dine elsewhere unless I heard something spectactular about the chef or menu here.
The meeting went well as it was a) informative, b) fact clarifying, and c) useful.  No, it wasn't funny, but it was useful and cool.
author: Mike C.

description: I absolutely loved this place for sunday brunch and can't wait to go again at the end of the month. I had a groupon which was very reasonable but even for regular price this buffet has a lot of variety, good quality food, good service, our champagne glasses were constantly getting refilled with out having to ask so that earned extra brownie points for me. The restaurant is cute and the jazz music was nice as well. I definitely plan on bringing a few people to experience this place.
author: Ms C C.

description:
This based on their "Power Lunch Buffet"

I bought a Groupon for $16 for 2 people (usually its $15.99 per person). I came here with my sisters on a Monday and it was not busy at all ( president's day). We were seated immediately and the hostess gave us a choice to sit anywhere we liked. We sat right in front of the food, of course! I was excited to come here because I looked at their daily menu for Monday's and I ready on their website that they will be serving grilled chicken with lavender Demi glace and grilled top sirloin steak with Zinfandel reduction.  I got in line and skipped the salad and saw seafood pasta.  I got a little bit of everything just to try such as their fried rice, roasted potatoes, rice noodles with veggies, cous cous, Mongolian beef, salmon, turkey and cheese sliders and more.  I was very disappointed with their selection. My question is where is my top sirloin steak?? Was it the Mongolian beef they were serving? The salmon was way overcooked and the beef was fried? It was crispy for some reason. After a plate of that food, I didn't want to eat any more so I just stayed with their fruits and it was sweet and juicy. I looked over their dessert section and got super excited when I saw mini red velvet cupcakes. My sister and I took most of them but were disappointed after the first bite. All of their cupcakes were hard-not moist at all. I think they were one day old and they decided to serve that to their guests. Their cheesecake were decent.  
If it wasn't for their service, this place would deserve one star. Their waitstaff were attentive.  They asked to take my plate when i was done with my food and when I asked for another fork, he handed the fork to in a matter of time.  Overall, my experience with this place was pleasant. It's just that their food is not good at all, especially when it's in a Hilton hotel in Chinatown. Seems like they were creating the food to be somewhat Chinese but American.
author: Irene L.

description:
Enjoyed Sunday Brunch.  Variety of food was great.  The Jazz serenade was marvelous.  To top it off, the champagne never ceased flowing.  

Will return in the future.
author: Delmar S.

description: This rating is for the bar as I didn't eat here. The draft beer selection was pretty good for a hotel bar. Four local beers (Trumer, Anchor, & Speakeasy). Prices weren't cheap but better than some of the craft beer bars nearby.
author: Joe P.

description:
MMMMMM!  Yummy ...

If you think this restaurant is the 'run-of-the-mill' hotel eatery, think again.  

The ambiance is modern, yet quite warm and inviting.  Especially inviting for nice conversations with good friends or a special 'someone'.  ... yes, I must drag Larry here someday.

One must try the seafood salad.  It is divine.

The wine list is quite complimentary to the food and the wait staff is gracious and attentive.

If you're on a business lunch, the Peet's Coffee counter is hittable on your way out.

Enjoy.
author: Michael O.

description:
Took a new hire out for lunch.  Perfect for business lunch.  Food is OK.  A bit on the expensive side for lunch in FiDi.

Service was slow considering there were a handful of diners.
author: Veritas V.

description:
I just sat at the bar and had a drink or few, so I can't speak to the food.  The decor is cool -- I especially like the cool flames when you arrive.  The drinks are spendy, as you'd expect.  I have to say the sidecar I ordered was one of the weirdest ones I've ever had!  The barkeep was a little standoffish, but was friendlier after he got a good tip.

I wouldn't go here as a destination, but if you're upstairs and feel like being sociable, it's worth taking the elevator down.
author: Andi T.

description:
Came here for lunch today. The service was not very good. I had to ask the waitress to come over, to take our drink order, to take our food order, to get the check, to get some water, etc. You get the point. 

The food was okay.  I had a chicken panini that was overloaded with too much cheese, which resulted in my not in eating more than 1/2 the bread.  The bell peppers, mushrooms, and chicken that came in the sandwhich were pretty good, although I smothered them all in 1/2 a bottle of ketchup! 

My friend ordered the soup of the day which was a chowder I think. It didn't look very good, but I don't prefer eating anything that's white in color.  Just a weird genetic thing (hahaha).

The atmosphere was nice. It's in a hotel, so it was pretty quiet and loungey.  Wine list was decent.
author: Jenny W.

description: Went here for the lunch buffet when we were in town. I definitely liked that one dish, forgot the name. Customer service was a Ok to me and my sis. Overall, I would try this place again.
author: Gleela Z.

description:
Lunch with Cecilia and Roy.  Roy picked the place because of the 1k points on Open Table.

Pretty fun lunch menu.  Things that caught my eye were the lobster roll, steak frites and a $16 banh mi.  Fortunately, I would never pay over $4 for a banh mi because I know better.  I can't believe anyone would pay that much for a Vietnamese sandwich, especially since there are much cheaper and better places close by.

We ordered the truffle oil parmesan fries, caesar salad with chicken and the wild mushroom pizza.  Everything was pretty tasty and our waiter was friendly and attentive.  The water guy was also on top of his game, never letting our glasses go empty.  Total with tax and tip was $45.  Not bad at all.
author: Lynnie P.

description: This place is OK - a 2.5. I went a few times because I stayed at the Hilton. Tried it for breakfast, lunch and dinner over the course of a week. The breakfast was not good and super expensive. Lunch (soup and salad) was alright, dinner (chicken entree) was OK. The service is excellent and atmosphere is nice, but the food just doesn't live up. If I hadn't stayed at the hotel I wouldn't have continued to go.
author: Sooz V.

description:
Renovation work has nicely modernized the ol' Holiday Inn Lobby.  

Had an enjoyable business lunch @ 750.  Friendly service, good quiet ambiance to hold a conversation with ease. We split the 750 Trio Appetizer - olive tapenade, garlic hummus, and slices of toasted foccacia - delicious!  Also had the Seafood Salad - *huge* shrimp with chunks of crab and greens - YUM!

***

They also have a happy hour special on the bar side of 750. Monday thru Friday, 2p-7p.  50% off appetizers.  I'll have to come back.
author: Cathy K.

description: Went for breakfast. The hostess and waiter were pleasant. The buffet was good and included some Asian food as well as usual American buffet items. All of the fruit was fresh and of top quality as to be expected at a Hilton. It was a good deal with the yelp coupon, but $23 for a breakfast buffet is hard to shell out.
author: Jason M.

description:
Now three stars doesn't mean bad, it means average. While four stars would be great, and five stars is outta this world. 

Bar - four stars for yummy cocktails, nice cocktail waitress, and cool ambiance. The seating is comfy with lots of cushions and big red "thrones" to sit in, and a cozy gas fire that comes out of crushed glass, giving a "fire and ice" illusion.  The only reason it's not five stars is because the place is totally empty, so you can't watch people.

Restaurant Ambiance - 3 stars. Not as cool as the Bar area, a little too formal, yet exposed. No sexy seating or booths to make it romantic, and too vast to make for good people watching (the only people there besides us were fat tourists from the midwest).

Service - 4 stars. The waitstaff was friendly and helpful. As someone else put it they were a little clumsy, but trying hard. They weren't telepathic though. 

Food - 3.5 stars. The food was above average actually (good fresh ingredients, well flavored), but nothing extraordinary. The portions were generous, almost too generous in some cases (such as the seafood kabob). I had a ravioli with porcini mushrooms, asiago cheese and pesto. It was pretty decent, but all the entrees were overpriced being that it is a hotel restaurant.   There was only one item on the prix fixe menu, which was a roasted chicken.  It was pretty standard, but had moroccan touches of almonds, not enough to really take it to the next level of deliciousness.

Wine list - 2 stars. The wine list, quite frankly, sucked. It was mostly Sonoma/Napa wines (for the tourists I presume, one of the biggest problems with California hotel wine lists) and not good Sonoma/Napa wines, but the larger vineyards, nothing "boutique". I'm not a wine snob, but the list was just way too small and hardly any wines by the glass. 

Dessert - Too stuffed to eat dessert, but Anand had gotten the prix fixe meal and it came with a creme brulee like custard. It was quite delicious in fact.

Would we go back? No. Not exciting or edgy enough for us, but if you are from Wisconsin and have to stay at the Hilton, you could probably eat one meal there if you didn't feel like walking a couple blocks to Yuet Lee for some Hong Kong style Chinese, or checking out dozens of Italian places in North Beach, or even the Helmand with it's fantastic Afghani food.
author: Darcy V.

description: Another Diva Nite. Cowboy Beef Chilli, jalapeño corn bread was pretty tasty, not what I had expected; herbed crusted pan seared salmon was savory with a crisp, I didn't care for the steamed brown rice with citrus avocado relish - it wasn't really a relish, just 2 pieces of avocado placed on top of the rice (boring); chocolate decadent cake with raspberry sauce was very "decadent"/rich and cosmos, loved them! Truffle macaroni & cheese, applewood smoked bacon, truffle oil was good, creamy and had the right amount of bacon; buttermilk fried boneless chicken, garlic mashed potatoes with horseradish jus was filling; Red Velvet Cake with bourbon pecan praline, very moist. Pan seared halibut, soy ginger garlic pineapple glaze with sautéed oyster mushroom and steamed jasmine rice with a coke - sounds better that what was expected. We ended up going to Pinkberry for frozen yogurt. (Good for e-scrip dining)
author: Mia B.

description: The jazz band was excellent! Free champagne! I'm a gal who likes her music and booze on the early side so noonish on a sunday is perfect on superbowl sunday. Our son bought us the half-off groupon for xmas and here we were. Never would have visited the hilton otherwise. Decorations were spectacular and thematic for chinese new year, red lanterns and dragons, lifted my spirits. The food was good if u choose wisely. Crab cakes, natch! Crab claws also good as it gets. Smoked salmon was buttery and plenty of accompaniments should u choose. Prime rib was good, not great, but all u want with jus and horseradish alongside. dont try the salmon, was overroasted. Asparagus was perfect, served with the crab cakes. Spinach, served with the salmon, was ok. My dessert looked like an il fornaio muffin, cherries and lemon and succulent bread/cake. Very good and plenty sweet for me. The servers kept refilling my champagne and changing plates, all with good cheer. If you have a group of picky white food eaters this would be a stress-free option. Kids and elders in the mix seemed equally pleased. To me, the music was the highlight, they definitely noticed our interest and played to please. Overall, very high quality environment, tables set apart so no crowding. Noise was low, so talking was not a problem. Food was good, not my best sf food but very good. Valet parking for two hours included. So for $40 we ate and drank and were entertained with free parking. Great value and hats off to hilton! Staff was 5+ overall.
author: Kelly K.

description: This restaurant located in Hilton Hotel.  It has nice decor and atmosphere.  We ordered chicken panini and mushroom ravioli. Both are nicely prepared and very presentable.  Delicious!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Food - 5 of 5
Atmosphere - 4.5 of 5
Pricing - 4 of 5
Service - 4 of 5

I don't know about everyone else that wrote a review, but for me, the food at this place was amazing. Stumbling in on a chilly evening in the city, this place had the atmosphere that just felt soothing.  You are first greeted by the warmth of an open fire place right before you enter the restaurant.  Seating at this place was pretty open as it wasn't crowded at all (don't know whether that's a good thing or bad), which made it very relaxing.  For the most part, service wasn't that bad.  The hostess greeted us when we got there and took us to our table where the waiter then took over and was attentive to our needs for the most part the whole night.

On to the good stuff... I was torn with what to order as the menu had multiple dishes that I wanted to indulge myself in.  As luck would have it, the sous chef (Virgil, I believe) that night happened to be walking around and checking in on the dishes the guests were having.  We stopped him on his way back and asked if he could suggest something for us.  He asked me what I felt like and I told him that a good steak would hit the spot.  Without hesitation, he suggested that I try his "special" marinated rib-eye with grilled prawns.  I happily obliged and served to me was probably one of the most succulent and delicious seafood/steak dishes I have ever had.

The portions were really generous and dish itself was ooooo sooooo goooooood.  The steak and prawns were marinated and grilled to perfection.  Not one word was spoken at the table when the food was being consumed besides the occasional "mmmmm" (while eyes were rolling backwards).  

To top it all off, we ordered a tiramisu which was equally as good.  Wondering why we haven't had something similar to it before, we found out from the staff that the tiramisu was imported from Italy..!!!

The only thing that I have to point out is that they claim to be a Mediterranean/Greek themed restaurant but didn't really have many dishes from the culture.  

The food is good none the less so this place is definitely a personal recommendation...
author: Herman C.

description: I was only here for drinkies, but love-love-love the contemporary look and feel of this restaurant's bar ... and of the hotel's renovation in general. It's come a long way from the creepy Holiday Inn of days gone by and is now a swanky and sophisticated FiDi jewel. Very nice selection of wines and low-key enough to actually enable you to carry on a conversation, so major points. If it helps, the grub I spied looked quite tasty, but we were hunting for a convenient place to meet and 750 fit the bill. Oh, and for the record -- Paris Hilton was no where in sight.
author: Gregor G.

description: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Food was served promptly, partly as a benefit of dining on a quiet night. Had the shrimp fried rice which had very generous portions (2 could eat well easily) and the bread pudding for dessert. Both were delicious.
author: Lance P.

description: Had a wonderful birthday lunch here.  Food was great, service was even greater.  I will definitely dine here again.
author: r w.

description: This is our second time for Sunday Brunch at 750 Restaurant & Bar. The first time was Mother's Day, They had so many reservations that they used a large conference room on the third floor. This second time was at the regular restaurant on the main floor which was warmer and much more comfortable than the large conference room. The food selections were very good and fresh and worth the price of the brunch! Cold appetizers includes fresh Oysters, Mussels and crab legs. The carving station features Roast Prime Rib. A very nice selections of desserts featuring my favorite Carrot Cake! One of the best in the city! And the Champagne and OJ kept coming, until we said enough! A plus is the Jazz band playing all our old favorite music to keep us happy while we're indulging!  Will definitely come back!
author: Patricia C.

description: This restaurant has lovely food and attentive waiters. The appetizers are large enough to be an entree. I had polenta with wild mushrooms and black truffle oil. For my entree I had the 750 Kabob, which was lobster, steak, prawns, bell peppers, onions, and black figs. It was excellent. My boyfriend had the lamb shank, which was very tender. Both our portions were large enough that we were too full for dessert.
author: Julia D.

description: This place is great. Our waiter was very friendly and decent prices for the food. 4 star because there was not a lot of selections (to me) in the menu.
author: John M.

description: I came here on the new year sunday brunch. I got the $39 groupon deal for two people. I think it is a pretty good deal because it includes fresh oyster, crab leg, giant prawn and prime rib. I think the crab leg, cocktail prawn and the desert are excellent. The crab cake is a little bit salty and the prime rib doesn't taste good but overall the live jazz and the ambiance are very good.
author: angel w.

description:
This is what you expect from a Hilton Hotel Restaurant/Bar. 

The decor is nice, what with the eternal flames powered by gas. 

$12 drinks? Seems to be the place for a business traveler to use the expense account. Can't really see locals going here. 

We had free drinks coupons but everything ended up being expensive all tolled anyway.

Be sure to check out the nearby vending machine with (what would be from Costco) 12-cent bottles of water going for $3. 

Maybe a good place to hang out while waiting for friends near North Beach or Chinatown?
author: J A.

description: Stay in the bar side!  The drinks were pretty good (although two different drinks . . the Pomegranite Cosmo and ??? tasted the same).  The bar has  better decor.  The place was pretty dead (which some people would love).  Makes for easy conversation.  The wait service was almost too much . .. they had nothing else to do.  Also, we ordered some of the recommended dishes (like the 750 Kebob).  It was pretty lame . . and the scallops on it were not fresh.  My friend had the lamb and it was the gamiest I've had in a while.  The best part about the meal were the appetizers and dessert.  We received a complimentary (i.e. birthday) dessert of homemade pineapple sorbet that was pretty amazing.  Just fruit . .no weird additives.  However, I don't think I will return.
author: Jay H.

description:
If I could give negative stars I would. 

It says something about a place when it's 1/2 filled and somehow all the customers are disgruntled bc of poor service. I don't think it's that hard to see a patron sit down and throw a menu at them...oh wait...they literally did just throw menus at us and then ran off into some corner of the restaurant where they could properly ignore us.  Then after asking the waiter to take our order...we were brushed aside bc apparently he was too busy pissing off other customers. We would have left but we were tired and just wanted a bite to eat before going back to our rooms. 20 minutes later someone finally came, took our drinks and entree order...of course they only brought 2 out of the 3 drinks (that 3rd water must have had to been pumped out of a well or something for it to take that long). We then realized a few tables around us got bread and we didn't so we asked for bread. The waiter looked at us like we were asking for one of his organs. Um no. Just bread. Like you're supposed to automatically give. Cause you know...you're our waiter...and um...this is a restaurant right?! 

Anyway, we eventually got that last water, bread and our entrees (which was nothing exciting - subpar food that is overpriced because they managed to have some interior designer come in to make things look fancy). I wanted to subtract tip from them but I guess it doesn't work that way. 

By the way, when the table across from you is served their entrees before they even get their drinks (which causes a screamfest at the manager who of course then acts sooo apologetic), another table has to chase someone down to pay their bill, and an old man has to hobble up to the bar to get his own menu after unsuccessfully trying to get service....then I think your restaurant has a problem. They might as well put a sign outside saying "Come on in. We want to charge you for ruining your day."
author: Anita W.

description:
There is absolutely nothing special about this place whatsoever. They do attempt to make the place settings and ambiance worthy of its fairly high prices, and while the quality of the food itself is acceptable, the service is slow and altogether lacking.

When we arrived, there was only one other table seated. Once presented with our menus, several minutes passed before we were asked for our order. After ordering, we had to wait a good ten minutes before they even brought out the bread! Then our food was taking forever (at least another twenty minutes after the bread came out), so to compensate, the waiter offered us complimentary house salads. A nice gesture, for sure, but it still completely puzzled me how it could take so long to prepare an appetizer, a burger, and a panini. After another several minutes, they finally brought out our entrees...completely forgetting that we had ordered a calamari to start! After we had halfway finished our meal, they finally brought out our appetizer. Pretty crappy service for what should have been considered a fine dining experience. Even after handing over the credit card to pay the bill, we had to wait several minutes until it was returned, even though there were two waiters serving a meager six tables (each with only one or two guests).

While the food was by no means bad, the incompetence of the waiting staff made the entire experience nearly painful, and I definitely won't be returning... no matter who's picking up the bill.
author: Willy C.

description: atmosphere and the design looks nice.  The renovations look good.  Unfortunately, the food was not impressive.  It was just ok.  I had the kobe burger and it was good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  We had really good service though.  But this is really just standard hotel food.
author: AhLin C.

description: Took my mom here for lunch on Saturday as part of the Dine About Town promotion. It's hard to find a place on the Dine About Town list that's open for lunch on Saturday, but this seemed like a good possibility. Sadly, it's didn't work out so well. Although the dining room is snazzy, the atmosphere was super quiet and formal, like the empty hotel restaurant that it was. Service was clumsy but attentive. The Dine About Town prix fixe menu had no choices--- vegetable minestrone, a seafood salad and tiramisu. The soup was ordinary, the salad had too much  mayonnaise and only the tiramisu was really decent. The stale focaccia and lukewarm, weak coffee were par for the course. Will not return.
author: Lev O.

description: Happy Hour is a happy hour here at Seven Fifty! Appetizers are half off. Yummy garlic fries, onion rings, wings, calamari, nachos, etc etc! cool set up and good service! My pomegranate martini was good and the second glass was strong! Great place to have a happy hour!
author: Jesse J.

description:
I booked a reservation here after checking out the menu online.  I was SO excited for the truffled mac and cheese, along with some other great looking dishes.  Unfortunately, we were really disappointed...The mac and cheese was like a crappy kids pasta soaked in butter, no truffles or much cheese to be found.  The rest of the food was sub-par at best, except for the French Onion Soup...that was great.  

The food and wine list are over-priced.  We were the only people in the restaurant, and our service was REALLY slow....
author: Andi B.

description: Went on a Saturday night and it was just dead in the dining room.  I know hotel restaurants are difficult but the place was cool.  Had this double bar thing going on that was fun as my friend was late and it made eavesdropping quite easy. Anyway!  The portions are huge!  I had the kebob and took one whole skewer home.  The scallops were a great app and the cous cous was quite tasty too.
author: Misti L.
